recommendations: Tina Zecher
Connecting students with meaningful research opportunities to develop the critical thinkers of tomorrow
September 8, 2017, Tina worked with Anisha in different groups

I first met Anisha in the fall of 2016 through my role at Arizona State University.  Our team partnered with the student organization that is led by Anisha for this event.  Anisha is one of the most driven and positive students I have ever had the pleasure of meeting.  She takes on any responsibility that is given to her with grace and delivers outcomes beyond expectations each time.  Anisha is not afraid to take chances at the risk of failing and quickly adapts to each situation as needed.  She is always willing to take the first step to network and make connections in an effort to bring together a diverse group of people for the betterment of a project.  She is well-organized, creative, and is able to delegate responsibilities as needed.  Anisha’s greatest strength is the passion she has for her work, which keeps her motivated through all of the challenges of a project.  She is a leader among her peers and without a doubt has the unique ability to combine creativeness, vision, and technical skills to lead a development group to create tomorrow’s next big innovation.
Tina Zecher

Matthew Calcote
Software Engineer & Scrum Master at Connexta LLC
August 24, 2016, Anisha worked with Matthew in the same group

Anisha joined my team at Connexta over the summer as an intern. During this time, she quickly began to contribute in meaningful ways despite her relative inexperience with the tools and software we were using. One thing that quickly stood out about Anisha was her willingness to engage members of the team and ask questions with an earnest desire to learn. This sincerity coupled with her technical ability and friendly demeanor helped her fit in right away. By the time the summer was over we were disappointed to lose a teammate, not just an intern.
